data.title: Bullet shells bounce off water
data.body: The bullet shells do not sink into water blocks, but stay on top of the surface like the water was a solid wall.

data.title: hooks meshroads up to the material system for castrays
data.body: (at a minimum sound playback)

data.title: Footstep sounds on decals do not work
data.body:
When you assign footstep sounds and other material effects to materials that are used as decal, for example a decal road, you will not get the according effects when you are on it.
For example you paint a decal road over grass and when you walk on it, it sounds like grass and not like road.

data.title: Ugly artifacts with decal road
data.body:
In the new version there are ugly artifacts on the decal road, it looks like the corners don't get proper UV-mapping which results in extremely stretched pieces, like here: http://imgur.com/Wmq0g1V
I think this issue is new and was not there some version before.

data.title: Unable to compile v3.8 with VS2015 [fix included]
data.body:
When compiling, build log reports issues with dxerr.lib and __vsnprintf function.
As an workaround, add this line:
  int (WINAPIV \* __vsnprintf)(char _, size_t, const char_, va_list) = _vsnprintf;
in gfxD3D9Shader.cpp after #include "gfx/D3D9/gfxD3D9Device.h"

data.body: Mac OS Version Torque3d

data.title: improved radio button
data.body: The radio button looks a bit weird so I changed it.

data.title: Removed unused vertex colors from GFXWaterVertex
data.body: Colour is sent via a uniform in the pixel shader, this must be old code leftover from a previous water system or something like that. No point sending data that is never used.

data.title: Volumetric Fog with corrections
data.body: Based on the Winterleaf PR #1059, this adds corrections so that it works with HDR being active, and also utilizes ambient color so that it works with day/night cycles, rather than being unlit during low-light settings.

data.title: Removed unused vertex formats from ScatterSky
data.body: I noticed this while working on DX11 stuff, scattersky has unused vertex formats. Thought i would do a separate PR in case it got lost in the DX11 branch

data.title: TAML, Assets and Modules implementation
data.body:
Initial implementation of the TAML, Asset and Module systems ported from T2D.

This is everything necessary for the base implementation and doesn't override any existing functionality. It comes with a blank example asset and a ShapeAsset that loads a shape file and stores the TSShape for later reference.

data.title: shadow caching
data.body:
SPECIAL NOTE: highly suggest https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/1441 or a variation thereof to prevent debug spew and false-postives for occlusion results.

With significant research, development and prototyping assistance from both @andr3wmac (shaders and partial hook work), and @LuisAntonRebollo (additional culling)

System operates as follows:
1) materials are given an additional castDynamicShadows boolean entry. (Default at time of writing is true by request. Personal usage at time of writing defaults to false. value is default-initialized in materialDefinition.cpp. script/gui exposed)
2) lights are given a staticRefreshFreq and dynamicRefreshFreq (in milliseconds). script/gui exposed
3) materials are (effectively) sorted into dynamic and static shadowmap render lists based on flag. (see shadowMapPass.cpp)
4) initial shadowmaps are generated for each light and 'list'.
5) as each refreshFreq times out, the relevant shadowmap for a given light is refreshed.

Special notes:
dynamicRefreshFreq for all lights is set to a (script exposed) 8MS refresh timer.
StaticRefreshFreq for the lions share of lights defaults to 250 MS (1/4 of a second)
scattersky's embedded light, which is intended to operate in a mobile manner, defaults to 8
to reiterate, these are all customizable per-light via script/inspector gui in the case of alternate project needs.

data.title: (mostly) resolves errors involving beginning queries on the same object in succession without a break.

warnings.

data.title: explosion cover miscalc
data.body: %distscale can actually end up negative. causes miscalculations for applyimpulse and the like (or even healing if you've hacked in the capacity for negative damage)

data.title: Backend correction for the rigid vs rigid collision resolver:
data.body:
First line is to ensure similar behavior to current regarding pushback on the object doing the colliding.
Second line applies an impulse to the rigid that was collided with.
